speaker: Clinician
text: Marcus, quick recap: apply a pea-sized smear of the 0.025 % tretinoin only at bedtime after washing, not on wet skin. Expect dryness, mild burning, maybe worse breakouts the first month—use fragrance-free moisturizer each morning. If you run outside, add SPF 30. One tube should last eight weeks; no early refills approved, so stretch it. Albuterol stays ‘as needed,’ two puffs, max every four hours.

speaker: Patient
text: Uh, I—I keep forgetting the steps. So I wash, wait till my face’s dry, then dot the cream, right? And if it stings during practice tomorrow, do I skip? Also, my inhaler’s empty again, and the pharmacy said no more refills—what am I supposed to do? I feel really lost.
